content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata>  <idinfo>   <citation>                           <citeinfo>                                  <origin>Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement Gulf of Mexico OCS Region</origin>                                  <pubdate>20141224</pubdate>                                  <title>Outer Continental Shelf Oil and Natural Gas Platforms - Gulf of Mexico Region NAD 27</title>                                  <geoform>vector digital data</geoform>                                  <pubinfo>                                      <pubplace>New Orleans, LA</pubplace>                                      <publish>Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement Gulf of Mexico OCS Region</publish>                                  </pubinfo>                                  <onlink>http://www.data.bsee.gov/homepg/pubinfo/repcat/arcinfo/zipped/platform.zip</onlink>                                  <onlink>http://www.data.bsee.gov/homepg/data_center/mapping/geographic_mapping.asp</onlink>                           </citeinfo>                 </citation>   <descript>    <abstract>This data set contains point locations for oil and gas platforms (structures) located in the Gulf of Mexico federal waters. Note: Platforms are being added or modified continuously; obtaining updates of this database are required to know the true distribution of platform data.Because GIS projection and topology functions can change or generalize coordinates, these GIS files are considered to be approximate and are NOT an OFFICIAL record.Contains the platform locations as of December 2014. Used ArcCatalog to create shape files.</abstract>    <purpose>The oil and gas installation data is used for reference in maps showing coastal features in the Gulf of Mexico.  Current active platforms for the Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement, Gulf of Mexico OCS Region; data is updated and posted on the website on a monthly basis, typically on the first of each month. This is the platform locations from TIMS GOM as of December 2014</purpose>   </descript>   <spdom>    <bounding>     <westbc>-97.113264</westbc>     <eastbc>-90.219919</eastbc>     <northbc>30.194974</northbc>     <southbc>26.035697</southbc>    </bounding>   </spdom>   <keywords>                         <theme>                                 <themekt>None</themekt>                                 <themekey>PI</themekey>                                 <themekey>TIMS PI Dump</themekey>                                 <themekey>Public Information</themekey>                         </theme>                         <theme>                                 <themekt>NGDA Portfolio Themes</themekt>                                 <themekey>National Geospatial Data Asset</themekey>                                 <themekey>NGDA</themekey>                                 <themekey>Utilities Theme</themekey>                          </theme>                 </keywords>   <accconst>None</accconst>   <useconst>The data was developed within the U.S. Government; no proprietary rights may be attached to them nor may they be sold to the U.S. Government as part of any procurement of ADP products or services.This data is NOT to be used for any MAS products</useconst>                 <browse>                        <browsen>http://www.data.bsee.gov/images_opt/graphics/gis/GOMR_Platform_structures.png</browsen>                        <browsed>Image depicting the location of platforms in US Gulf of Mexico</browsed>                 </browse>                   <datacred>Originally created by Chief Mapping and Automation Section-GOM</datacred>   <native>Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.5.4400</native>  </idinfo>  <spdoinfo>   <direct>Vector</direct>   <ptvctinf>    <sdtsterm>     <sdtstype>Entity point</sdtstype>     <ptvctcnt>7239</ptvctcnt>    </sdtsterm>   </ptvctinf>  </spdoinfo>  <spref>   <horizsys>    <geograph>     <latres>8.9830550972891532e-009</latres>     <longres>8.9830550972891532e-009</longres>     <geogunit>Decimal Degrees</geogunit>    </geograph>    <geodetic>     <horizdn>D North American 1927</horizdn>     <ellips>Clarke 1866</ellips>     <semiaxis>6378206.4</semiaxis>     <denflat>294.9786982</denflat>    </geodetic>   </horizsys>  </spref>  <eainfo>   <detailed>    <enttyp>     <enttypl>platform</enttypl>    </enttyp>    <attr>     <attrlabl>OBJECTID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Internal feature number.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>Shape</attrlabl>     <attrdef>Feature geometry.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <udom>Coordinates defining the features.</udom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>COMPLEX_ID</attrlabl>     <attrdef>The unique identifier assigned to a single man-made structure or a group of structures connected by a walkway.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Data Elements - [DDELEMENT]</attrdefs>    </attr>    <attr>     <attrlabl>STRUCTURE_</attrlabl>     <attrdef>The name of the structure assigned by the owner.</attrdef>     <attrdefs>Data Elements - [DDELEMENT]</attrdefs>    </attr>   </detailed>  </eainfo>         <distinfo><resdesc>Map Files</resdesc><distliab>Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.
